title: Geographical unit
description:
A unit in the organization dedicated to a region of the world.

Geographical units are defining a hierarchy of regions operated by an organization. 
They are mostly use to enforce user access restrictions, partitioning data or reporting.

name.description: A unique internal name of the geographical unit.

fullName.description:
The fully qualified name of the unit including names of its parent units.   
Units composing the full name are separated by a slash character (`/`).

```
/AMER
/AMER/NORTH/CA
/AMER/NORTH/US      
/EMEA
/EMEA/FR
/APAC
...
```

displayName.description: The name of the geographical unit in the user interface.

description.description: A short overview of the unit in the organization.

parent.description: The geographical unit owner of this unit.

children.description: All other geographical units under this unit.
